description: Returns, adds, edits, and removes one connection for a stream workspace in the specified project. To use this resource, the requesting API Key must have the Project Owner roles.

DBRoleToExecute.description: The name of a Built in or Custom DB Role to connect to an Atlas Cluster.

Role.description: The name of the role to use. Can be a built in role or a custom role.

Type.description: Type of the DB role. Can be either BuiltIn or Custom.

StreamsKafkaAuthentication.description: User credentials required to connect to a Kafka Cluster. Includes the authentication type, as well as the parameters for that authentication mode.

Mechanism.description: Style of authentication. Can be one of PLAIN, SCRAM-256, SCRAM-512, or OAUTHBEARER.

Username.description: Username of the account to connect to the Kafka cluster.

Password.description: Password of the account to connect to the Kafka cluster. Review [AWS security best practices for CloudFormation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/security-best-practices.html#creds) to manage credentials.

ClientSecret.description: OAuth client secret. Review [AWS security best practices for CloudFormation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/security-best-practices.html#creds) to manage credentials.

StreamsKafkaSecurity.description: Properties for the secure transport connection to Kafka. For SSL, this can include the trusted certificate to use.

BrokerPublicCertificate.description: A trusted, public x509 certificate for connecting to Kafka over SSL.

Protocol.description: Describes the transport type. Can be either PLAINTEXT or SSL.

Config.description: A map of Kafka key-value pairs for optional configuration. This is a flat object, and keys can have '.' characters.

Networking.description: Networking configuration for AWS PrivateLink connections.

Type.description: Type of network access. PRIVATE_ENDPOINT for AWS PrivateLink.

ConnectionId.description: Unique identifier of the AWS PrivateLink connection.

RoleArn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role for AWS Lambda connection.

ProjectId.description:
Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies your project. Use the [/groups](#tag/Projects/operation/listProjects) endpoint to retrieve all projects to which the authenticated user has access.

**NOTE**: Groups and projects are synonymous terms. Your group id is the same as your project id. For existing groups, your group/project id remains the same. The resource and corresponding endpoints use the term groups.

Profile.description: Profile used to provide credentials information, (a secret with the cfn/atlas/profile/{Profile}, is required), if not provided default is used

ConnectionName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the stream connection. In the case of the Sample type, this is the name of the sample source.

InstanceName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the stream instance. Deprecated: Use WorkspaceName instead.

WorkspaceName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the stream workspace.

Type.description: Type of the connection. Can be Cluster, Kafka, Sample, AWSLambda, or Https.

ClusterName.description: Name of the cluster configured for this connection.

ClusterProjectId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the project containing the cluster for cross-project cluster connections.

BootstrapServers.description: Comma separated list of server addresses.

Url.description: URL endpoint for HTTPS type connections.

Headers.description: HTTP headers for HTTPS type connections.
